Key Match Events: Mac Allister scored the crucial opener in the 53rd minute.
Julian Alvarez scored a long-range stunner in the 84th minute.
Paulo Dybala scored the third goal in stoppage time.
Pre-Game Insights: Angel Di Maria announced his international retirement after winning the Copa America.
Lionel Scaloni's side stayed atop the CONMEBOL standings in World Cup qualifying, with 18 points out of 21.
Post-Match Reflections: Emiliano Martinez made an outstanding save in the first half and was a rock in the late stages.
Lisandro Martinez was a threat in attack from set-pieces.
Nicolas Otamendi completed 96 percent of his 84 total passes.
Rodrigo De Paul was composed on and off the ball and led as a veteran should.
Julian Alvarez played a decent decoy to help Mac Allister bag his effort.
Giovani Lo Celso subbed on for an injured Gonzalez early in the second half and bagged an assist for Alvarez's stunner.
Marcos Acuna helped close out the match with 11 minutes to spare.
Paulo Dybala scored the third goal off the bench.
Alejandro Garnacho was lively off the bench in his 11 minutes, plus stoppages.
Lionel Scaloni should be thrilled with the second-half performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at Estadio Mas Monumental.
A tribute to Angel Di Maria was held before the match.
